title: James Giffen, Who Was Embroiled in ‘Kazakhgate,’ Dies at 81
description: The government charged him with funneling $78 million in bribes to Kazakhstan, but dropped the case after a judge decided he had acted with C.I.A. approval.
dc:creator: Clay Risen
media:description: James H. Giffen in 2000. His merchant bank was a go-between for Western energy companies eager to exploit Kazakhstan’s vast oil fields. “He was Washington’s de facto ambassador to Kazakhstan,” a former C.I.A. official said.
